timeline.bodyText:
Keeping a hardcoded list for this is not really the best idea.
I get that this will save a lot of performance though...
By using a switch case here with the values SMOKER, LECTERN, etc... you will be breaking 1.13 compatibility though since those constants do not exist then.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+package io.github.thebusybiscuit.slimefun4.utils;
+import org.bukkit.block.Block;
+public final class BlockUtils {
+
+    public static boolean hasInventory(Block block) {
+        if (block == null) return false;
+
+        switch (block.getType()) {
+            case CHEST:
+            case TRAPPED_CHEST:
+            case FURNACE:
+            case DISPENSER:
+            case DROPPER:
+            case HOPPER:
+            case BREWING_STAND:
+            case SHULKER_BOX:
+            case WHITE_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case ORANGE_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case MAGENTA_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case LIGHT_BLUE_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case YELLOW_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case LIME_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case PINK_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case GRAY_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case LIGHT_GRAY_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case CYAN_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case PURPLE_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case BLUE_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case BROWN_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case GREEN_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case RED_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case BLACK_SHULKER_BOX:
+            case ENDER_CHEST:
+            case BARREL:
+            case BLAST_FURNACE:
+            case LECTERN:
+            case SMOKER:
+                return true;
+            default:
+                return false;
+        }
+    }

timeline.bodyText: Please create a private empty constructor here to prevent instantiation.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Never use wildcard imports...
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText:
An AssertionError is completely inappropriate here.
No Assertion was made and catching an exception just to throw another one serves no benefit here.
You hsould instead properly log the exception rather than creating a new one that makes no real sense here.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: What exactly is the advantage of using this right here?
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText:
It's same as JsonObject#toString(), but because we don't need the object, we can use JsonWriter directly without creating a new JsonObject.
This part of code is get called pretty often and keep showing on profiler. I need to measure it more to see if it could help with performance.
replies.author: DNx5

replies.bodyText: Alright, I see. Some actual performance figures would be cool but I will mark this one as resolved nonetheless. 👍
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: All of that could be reduced to one if-statement. other than having 17 cases here.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: I agree, this all can be reduced to the simple .endsWith statement which would be much simpler. I don't think we need an entire method for this.
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: This could be reduced in size to just Math.min(amount, getMaxStackSize
timeline.author: WalshyDev

timeline.message: Simplify and optimize the Cargo insertion

timeline.bodyText:
Slimefun has a built-in method for that. And there is no need for making that a field here.
You can do SlimefunPlugin.getMinecraftVersion().isAtLeast(MinecraftVersion.MINECRAFT_1_14) instead.
Your method would break for all 1.15 servers since you check for the exact version, not the minimum.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think Ender Chests have Inventories that you can interact with...
Since those are per-player not per-block.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Never override the .register() method.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: You should use the .postRegister() method instead for this.
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.message: Fix OreCrusher, add recipes on post-register
Move BlockUtils into cargo package. removed ender chest from the list. use slimefun's method to check minecraft version

simplify cargo withdraw methods.
trying to reduce unnecessary item clone as much as possible.

added leftover changes, and bug fixes.
with possibility of bringing more bugs
optimize Cargo Node's filter index saving.

timeline.bodyText: Space between package and imports
timeline.author: WalshyDev

timeline.bodyText: Space between imports and class.
timeline.author: WalshyDev

timeline.bodyText: There is no sense in storing this as a class member for each instance of CargoNet, things like that rather belong into the NetworkManager with an appropriate getter and javadocs comments.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText:
This is specifically made only for Cargo network. I don't think NetworkManager class should contain this, or should I made it for all types of Network?
How about moving it into:
if (tickDelayThreshold < SlimefunPlugin.getCfg().getInt("URID.cargo-network-tick-delay")) {
I see this kind of usage in some place
replies.author: DNx5

replies.bodyText:
Retrieving the value directly from the config should definitely be avoided, that would just contradict the prupose of optimizing that method anyway.
Even if the value is only for cargo nets, the NetworkManager may still be an appropriate place for that, if you simply call it "cargoTickDelay" accordingly.
To elaborate: The NetworkManager is just a singleton that holds references to all Networks and some config values.
Alternatively, if you really think it should stay in the CargoNet you should definitely make that field static, as it is not cargo network specific but rather a static constant.
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText:
This could probably use some comments explaining what it does.
I know that this delays cargo ticks to only be actually run every X time but it isn't immediately clear, so there should better be a comment for that.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText:
This statement would probably always return true if Im not mistaken since you removed these default values and added a continue; there.
So this condition could maybe be removed if Im not mistaken.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: maxSize would probably be a more sensible name for this variable here. "inSlotMaxSize" is rather unpleasant to read.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: currentAmount  would probably be a more sensible name for this variable here. "inSlotAmount" is rather unpleasant to read.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText:
This should me Math.min, not Math.max
since now you are taking the maximum of the two which will make the amount potentially exceed the max size.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Looks like you are missing a space there.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.message:

- Added comment to explain how the skipping ticks work
